reviews.review:
Joguei no console e fiz questão de ter ele na minha steam,principalmente pela sua história envolvente,que te deixa curioso sobre o próximo passo do personagem,o que ele vai fazer e o que vai acontecer.

Um dos melhores jogos que eu joguei ate hoje,tanto em gráfico quanto em jogabilidade leve e fluida e apos 3 anos do lançamento,esse jogo ainda me surpreende cada vez mais que a gente joga,a gente ve detalhes que não vimos antes,ai você para e pensa e procura na internet para entender melhor,e ve que faz sentido,ai fica surpreso kkk.
Enfim,a DLC chega e explica o resto do jogo,como ja joguei no console,posso falar que a reviravolta e surpreendente e triste ao mesmo tempo.
Recomendo demais,foi o único jogo que eu cheguei a chorar no final.
good all the way to the end. i LOVE the plot and the gameplay. 9/10 the only bad thing that i really did not like was the fight with elizabeth's mother. go buy and play it now, its great.
Maybe the best game ive ever played.
Everything about this game is worth your time. Amazing story that stays with you, beautiful design and fantastic gameplay. Bioshock Infinite is a masterpiece.

niveau gameplay c'est pas trop trop a la hauteur c'est juste moyen mais je le recommande quand meme  vu ça fluiditè est ces graphismes magnifique .
un jeu a ne pas rater .

The story is perplexing while strongly fascinating and contemplative...
Did it all really happen?
Is Booker dead?
Will he be with Anna?
Are these all coming to an end? Or they've never existed...
Отличная игра!
Советую!

I picked up this game during the winter sale and I'm quite mad at myself for not playing it until now. It's incredibly fast paced when following the storyline but it still has the open world exploring experience as you can go anywhere any time. I highly reccomend this game to those that want a "different" type of adventure.

Great and very fun combat, beautiful and colorful world, perfect and engaging story.

The plots for the previous bioshocks have been interesting but this beats them by a landslide. Ending was just perfect, making it feel depressing albeit it technically being a happy ending, it also brings out the inquisitive nature of players who didn't understand it, which is to say most of the playerbase. I have nothing to say about the combat, because it has always been great since previous installments, just a little more polished and kind of makes the use of abilities more important and impactful (Did not really use the plasmids in previous installments, about 90% shooting for me)

Oynayın görün pişman olmazsınız, harika hilkaye, fps, mükemmel fazla söze gerek yok.

10/10

This game was amazing up until it made no sense and I had to start jumping through dimensions. Little did I know that it would continue to make no sense and that the level design wasn't very good. I also did not expect the surprise ending where the boss battle was uninspired and not fun.

Also, don't make me attracted to a character it would be morally outrageous for my character to sleep with. Don't make me the pervert - you're the asshole that wrote the story.

P.S. The original story had Elizabeth with shaman powers and was going to have Native American themes and focus?! Yeah, good thing you dodged THAT bullet 2K. Wouldn't have wanted this super American game to have in any way done that.

Me ha parecido una maravilla de juego y eso que no soy fan de los shooter, pero gracias a la historia que tiene te pica a seguir jugando y avanzando en el juego. 

Recomendable 100% y con oferta 300% .
It's Bioshock...so it's amazing, play it, love it, chew it, enjoy it. <3
It's quite possibly the most overrated game on steam with poor writing to boot. It is short though, even though any link the story and action sequences have falls apart and overstay their welcome.

So i finished this game about five minutes ago, and i have to say it was an Awesome experience 

Pros:
 Vigors are interesting and fun to use,
         
Gear is a nice tweak to the gameplay adding different ways to start or end combat
          
The game makes you're companion not a burdan to protect but instead a useful Tweak to combat

The story nuf said

Branching options on how to handle combat, so maybe you want to defeat you're enemies just by possesing them
and picking them off that way, or maybe you want to go for a farming aproach by placing electricity traps and pulling people into them with undertow,

The guns are good, so good in fact sometimes i forgot that i had vigors,

The game is good but no game doesnt have a con

Cons:
   the game constantly takes control away from you to show you something a scripted scene could do
One of those games that kinda leaves you speechless at the end. It's definitely worth a playthrough.

Increible juego! Me arrepiento de haber esperado tanto para comprarlo. Una historia que te deja re flashao con un final que pff.... que se yo, no soy apto para escribir analisis pero algo que si puedo hacer es decirte que dejes de abrir la boca como un pelotudo en los coemntarios y compres ya esta obra maestra.

%100 RECOMENDADO. 11/10

AMAZING story amazing graphics -for its time 


AMAZING GAME

Si has jugado los anteriores, éste te volará la mente.

Jugablemente mejorado y aportando ambientación e historia marca de Ken Levine.

Saga muy recomendable para experimentarla al menos una vez.

Cant understand how feedback is so positive. The gameplay is nice and graphics ok but the story is woeful, i dont care for the characters or even want to help them. Not sure ill ever bring myself to complete it.

This game is freakin' messed up. Screw your happy ending. There is none. 

10/10

Отличная игра, с хорошей графикой и озвучкой персонажей. В игре есть тайники и головоломки за которые можно получить классные вещи. Оптимизация для слабых ноут/ПК, если честно, не очень. Запутанный сюжет с постоянной сменой локаций и ваших врагов/союзников. Советую выкрутить звук "речь" на максимум! Поймёте вы сюжет или же нет зависит от того, внимательно ли вы всё читали и следили за диалогами простых прохожих. 
P.S. Нет разницы, что выбрали "клетка" или "птица", "орёл" или "решка". Зайдите на "Wiki" и прочтите ВСЁ про эту игру и персонажей, поверьте мне, не пожалеете!
Я фанат этой игры, ждал продолжения и не пожалел что купил ее, сюжет классный, игра супер.

Яркая, запоминающаяся, местами жутками и таинственная, но неизменно захватывающая и поражающая прекрасными локациями, персонажами и перестрелками BioShock Infinite погрузит вас в свой мир с головой. Однозначно рекомендую.

Ok first up perfect 10/10 buy this game right now just do it.
now onto the serious part.
Bioshock infinite is an amazing game the story is great the combat is fun and amazing with tears, skylines, and of course vigors. Elizabeth is a really good character and booker can also be pretty funny from time to time (although I can't even count the amount of times I've heard "huh" in this game) But what I really loved is the combat, that was amazing jumping from skyline to skyline then jumping off bashing in the faces of your enemies after which you shoot crows in someones face and fire some explosives at them. This is the most fun I've had with first person shooter combat I've had in a while. Now onto the story. Well I don't want to spoil anything but it was good, confusing and... How do I describe this? mindfucky thats the word. But still a really good story that makes you think.

All in all this game was great please just buy it.
Dumbed down to the rock bottom, where is my system shock?
I'm not an FPS guy but this one was really compelling for me.

- Elizabeth

Cons:

- Can't marry her because of spoilers

Great Story, Easy Game play, and the ability to play how you want to. Another great Bioshock title.
An Incredibly compelling narrative taking the best aspects of a First Person Shooter. The absolute most fun one can have in an adventure game.
good

If you're a fan of Bioshock 1 and 2, be prepared to see this as a an entirely different game from the rest of the series. I tried really hard to get into this because BIOSHOCK, but it was lacking in anything I had loved about Rapture. The characters seemed pretty bland in comparison.

If you think of this as an entirely different game, I guess it was alright.
BEST GAME EVER!!!
Игра пражает своим сюжетом!

Bewertung vorab, Gesamt: 7,5/10
Spielzeit auf mittlerer Schwierigkeit: 10-15h, je nach Forscherdrang

Nachdem ich Bioshock 1 und 2 gespielt habe, bin ich mit hohen Erwartungen an 
das Spiel gegangen. Die Grafik ist sehr schön - die Atmosphäre auch. Storymäßig steht der 3. Teil der Reihe den beiden anderen in nichts nach, besonders was den Plot "Twist" am Ende betrifft. Allerdings ist das Spiel sehr linear aufgebaut, was im Prinzip in den Vorgängern ebenfalls der Fall war, aber es gibt hier keine multiplen Enden aufgrund getroffener Entscheidungen (wie im 2. Teil zB mit dem Ausbeuten der Little Sisters). Es gibt viele Waffen und Verbesserung eben jener, aber man könnte im Prinzip auch mit nur 2 Waffen rumlaufen (mehr kann man auch nicht auf einmal tragen), denn es findet sich immer genug Munition. Ich musste im ganzen Spiel nicht 1x Munition kaufen, auch keine Medipacks oder Salze. Das Spiel ist mMn VIEL zu EINFACH, selbst auf mittlerer Schwierigkeit. Gestorben bin ich maximal 3x wegen Schusseligkeit und die Finale Schlacht hab ich 2x verhauen weil ich die falschen Plasmide gewählt hab (P.S.: Die Krähenfähigkeit ist "OP"). Die Plasmidkombinationen sind wie in den Vorgängern sehr vielfältig, die Gegner verhalten sich auch relativ schlau. Allerdings ist der Shooter-Teil manchmal eintönig und repetitiv, weil man mit jeder Waffe jedem Gegner beikommt, solang man nur die richtigen Plasmide hat. Schön ist dass es verschiedene Ausrüstungen mit speziellen Boni anstelle der Körper-Mods der Vorgänger ins Spiel geschafft haben, und so wieder ein bisschen Strategie möglich ist, auch im Bezug auf Waffen-Verbesserungen.

Fazit: Relativ kurzweiliges Spiel mit guter/interessanter Story und gutem Ende, was sich
fast allein deswegen zu spielen lohnt. Ansonsten ein solider Shooter mit wenig Neuigkeiten,
etwas strategischem Tiefgang bei Waffen-/Plasmid-/ und Rüstungswahl und dezenter Optik.

Spielzeit: 10-15h (wenn man in jedem Winkel nach Munition etc sucht für die Errungenschaften) auf mittlerer Schwierigkeit (schwerere Modi erst nach 1x Durchspielen)
Story:        9/10
Grafik:       8/10
Gameplay: 6/10
Gesamt:   7,5/10

It took me 11 hours to finish this singleplayer only title witch is decent I think. The story is great and it was really interesting to see the characters development. I had no clue how it was going to end until the very last minute. Total mindfuck. Totally awesome.
Only chritique: I wish there were more longrange weapons.
9/10

NOT ONLY A GOOD FPS BUT AN ENJOYABLE STORY.

I landed on this saga only recently and i found it very very good. 

GOOD POINT:
- Great atmosphere, the world of Columbia is a beautiful vision. 
- The enemy and the "boss" are very challenging (at least in "Hard" mode). 
- The enemy A.I. is aggressive and not passive.
- VERY GOOD STORY, the game caught me to the bone. And what a TWIST.
- A few improvement in gameplay allow you to use different tactics in a conflict against enemies
- NPC very well written. They fell like "real".

BAD/LAME POINT
- A few bosses used to many time. 
- Improvement of weapons and vigors is so expensive that you will end up doing it very rarely.
- Maybe some of the enviroment are to closed on themself
- The city after the first few scene fels pretty empty and lifeless. few npc around the world.


But the strong point of this game is the story and its protagonist. This, in my opinion made this game what it is a very good story. the ending of this game is simply amazing and i cannot wait for the DLC to bring to story forward!

[h1]ATENCIÓN:[/h1] [b]Algunas cuestiones que voy a tratar en el Review son spoilers basados en este juego y en el 1er Bioshock, pero con la particular intención de llegar a querer explicar una opinión personal en cuanto al juego.[/b]

Creo que pocas veces me he levantado de mi asiento para aplaudir un juego al terminarlo, y eso que lo hice teniendo en consideración al 1er Knights of the Old Republic que me sacó lagrimas de emoción que ni los Mass Effect pudieron lograr, pero este juego bien que se lo merece y con eso aún me quedo corto. Ken Levine, el director de desarrollo de este juego, logró convencer a su publico de que joyas narrativas en las que el jugador pueda interactuar con la historia y con el ambiente en la que se desarrolla el juego, pueden generar experiencias realmente impresionantes, algo que puede perdurar en la memoria de los jugadores como algo mas que un juego, incluso mas allá de eso, como si de una aventura se tratase. No, este juego supera todo eso a punto de ser una obra de arte, y lo digo sin temor a equivocarme. 

Columbia es algo espectacular, no se realmente como habrá sido el proceso de desarrollo o de diseño de cada sector de esta ciudad pero para ser una ciudad ficticia en las nubes en pleno inicio del siglo XX con la 1era Gran Guerra a cuestas, es increible TODO lo que se puede ver: desde los afiches, hasta los NPCs (personajes no jugables), los negocios, la mercadería, las calles, etc. La cultura de la ciudad y su rutina está planteada de forma espectacular de forma de que el jugador realmente se sienta en un lugar acogedor y disfrute del ambiente que lo rodea con solo girar a 360° en su propio eje. Los scripts en estas secuencias no se notan porque el jugador va a estar demasiado sumergido en interactuar con el entorno, a diferencia de una misión de Call of Duty por dar un ejemplo. Para mi la belleza de Columbia se basa en contrastar la realidad politico-social de nuestra realidad a un mundo virtualmente imposible de llevarse a cabo. Y esa para mi es la atracción principal de la franquicia.

El juego permitirá visitar cada una de las zonas territoriales que contiene Columbia, mediante la cual ira viendo que la influencia social no le es exento a la naturaleza del hombre, por ende se va a poder ver que existen estratificaciones sociales, así como existe el desempeño de las clases media-alta en las zonas céntricas, en el resto se puede observar cómo es la rutina de las clases asalariadas se desempeña dentro de las fabricas de Fink y como se lleva a cabo la mas que archi-conocida "división del trabajo" que bien hablaba Karl Marx, en un mundo con las puertas ingresadas a la revolución industrial (que aquí estan por lo visto DEMASIADO avanzadas, para alegría del jugador) y como la jerarquía distribuye a sus trabajadores, etc. Cada uno cumple un rol en Columbia, y el juego trata de mostrar eso permanentemente.

Ahora bien, (sector que voy a entrar en spoilers, probablemente) si se habla de una ciudad que vuela y que tiene una tecnología que se mueve muy por encima a la que la civilización ha conocido hasta el momento, uno podría decir que sería un "mundo tipo", o mas bien un mundo perfecto, en que no habría desempleados, no habría hambre, no habrian conflictos... NO, nada mas alejado de la realidad. Así como existen asalariados, y clase proletaria, tambien existen la clase baja, la que destaca no solo porque algunos tengan piel de color, sino por sufrir de ser marginados por no compartir la visión "del profeta" (Comstock) y por supuestamente "no trabajar para ganarse el pan" por así decirlo. Algo que Andrew Ryan en Rapture (1er Bioshock) y Comstock parecen compartir. Mientras el 1ero lo llama a esta clase como "el parásito que influye en la Gran Cadena", Comstock la llama "la sodoma de abajo" pero así y todo una clase necesita a la otra para subsistir, pero esto no lo hace carente de la ironía de que aún asi existe la estratificación social y el desempeño del capitalismo dentro de un mundo cuya ciudad es totalmente ficticia, y como tal eso conlleva a la larga CONFLICTOS entre las clases sociales, como se va a contemplar a lo largo del juego, en este caso entre los Vox Populi liderados por Daisy Fitsroy contra Comstock y su ejercito, en una lucha de ideales. Lo que al principio era una sublevación por hacerse a la clase baja ser escuchada pronto se convierte en un intento desesperado de golpe de estado, y en un estallido de guerra civil, dejando a De Witt y a Elizabeth en el medio del conflicto y es aquí cuando el juego muestra su mas potencial desenlace. 

La gran Columbia que se mostraba en auge al principio del juego, en plena mitad del mismo ya deja de serlo para ser un páramo mas de los problemas sociales que aquejan a nuestra raza. Dicho esto, se puede observar el gran éxodo que empiezan a realizar las masas "burguesas" dentro del juego cuando empiezan a acercarse las fuerzas de Vox Populi, para destronar a Comstock. Caso muy similar al conflicto que sufrió Rapture entre "Atlas" y Andrew Ryan. Lo que hace considerar que, por muy hermoso que sea la idea de una ciudad bajo el oceano o sobre las nubes, el desenlace de estas ciudades utópicas son irrealizables a terminos reales debido a la interferencia humana, porque no todos somos "hermanos" como se nos quiere hacer creer, y que siempre va a haber conflictos que va a conducirnos a este tipo de confrontaciones o de revoluciones a la larga. Y esa para mi es LA BELLEZA que tiene esta franquicia y que Ken Levine le ha impregnado ENORMEMENTE a este juego, algo que no he visto en ningún juego de hoy en día. Una ciudad utópica se destruye a si misma por sus propios conflictos sociales, por ende es platónica porque es irrealizable en todo margen de análisis.

Ahora si, dejando eso en claro,  la siguiente atracción es sencillamente Elizabeth. Probablemente ella sea la mejor personaje jamás narrada en un video juego para mi. Es la idea de una princesa sacada de una fábula de Disney (o mas bien una doncella en apuros) y que va a ir evolucionando a medida que se desarrolla el juego, desde la chica ingénua atrapada dentro de una estatua enorme y protegida por un halcón de metal gigastesco, hasta el momento explícito en que empieza a cuestionarse a ella misma y a Booker si es correcto lo que han estado haciendo. En un espectacular despliegue de guionaje y storytelling, la otrora princesita de fábula, empieza a sufrir tanto los conflictos sociales como personales que tiene con su padre Comstock y lo que había comenzado como un intento furtivo de escapar hacia París, termina convirtiendose en una busqueda desesperada de respuestas y a confrontarse ella misma junto a De Witt con su propio inevitable destino. Elizabeth tiene un gran desarrollo dentro del juego, y no solo en cuestión narrativa que es donde destaca. Sabe ganarse el corazón del jugador, porque es él/ella quien vé a esta chica sufrir los diversos estados de ánimo a lo largo del mismo. Si un personaje logra influir por encima de la interacción común del jugador, quiere decir que el trabajo realizado es impecable y excelente como mínimo. Además de que tiende a ofrecerle items, desgarros para ayudar o monedas de plata al jugador cuando mas lo necesita, ella es parte esencial que complementa la historia de Columbia. Si esta ciudad era espectacular por si sola, Elizabeth es la cereza de la torta. Es sorprendente lo mucho que ella ha cambiado desde que se la vé por 1ra vez, hasta el final del juego, realmente está muy bien desarrollado su papel.

En fin, no por eso el juego no deja de ser una obra de arte, el cual si considero que ES. Me parece una de las mayores joyas de nuestra generación, y es una pena ver a una mente tan prestigiosa como la de Ken Levine retirarse de esta franquicia. Ojalá los futuros juegos de la saga que 2K saque tengan alguna cercana similitud de calidad a este, aunque joyas brillantes como esta no se repiten. Una Joya en BRUTO.

Vorweg kurz gesagt: Bioshock Infinite erzählt die Geschichte von Booker DeWitt und ist inhaltlich genau das, was ein Singleplayer Egoshooter sein sollte.

Das Gameplay des Spiels ist extrem vielseitig und trotzdem simpel in der Bedienung, grundsätzlich besteht schon aufgrund der vielen und vor allem unterschiedlichen Waffen schon fast ein Überangebot an möglichen Spielstilen. Von Nahkampf und Shotgun ist über Raketenwerfer, Pistole, Karabiner, Minigun und Salvengeschütz ist bis hin zu Scharfschützengewehren alles mit dabei, jeweils zwei Waffen kann der Spieler dabei gleichzeitig mitführen. Der Kampf fällt aufgrund diverser Gegnertypen dabei immer wieder anders aus und wird insbesondere durch die Fähigkeit, sich an "Skylines" entlang zu ziehen und somit schnell Richtung, Position und Ebene zu ändern, extrem dynamisch. Abwechslungsreiche Finisher-Moves sind zwar möglich, jedoch optional und stören den Spielfluss somit nicht. Weitere Ergänzungen bieten magische "Kräfte", für die jedoch "Salze" (Mana) gebraucht werden und temporäre Unterstützungen aus anderen Dimensionen. Da der Spieler jedoch erst nach und nach in diese Mechaniken eingeführt wird, entsteht kein Gefühl der Überforderung. Das Balancing ist dabei sinnvoll, mächtigere Waffen sind seltener, stärkere Kräfte erfordern mehr "Salze" und da eine vollautomatische Lebensregeneration ausbleibt, besteht stets die Herausforderung in Kämpfen, die einfach Spaß machen. Sollte Booker DeWitt eine Auseinandersetzung jedoch nicht überleben, so sind auch die Respawnpunkte fair gesetzt und trotz kleiner Kosten in der Bestrafung eher milde und sogar handlungstechnisch eingebunden. Wer einfach so aus der Wolkenstadt Columbia fällt, wird sogar kommentarlos wieder am Unglücksort abgesetzt, Frust kann so kaum aufkommen.

Grafisch sieht Bioshock Infinie dabei sehr gut aus, insbesondere der spezielle Grafikstil ist schön und in sich sowie mit dem gelungenen Soundtrack und der generellen "Anfang des 20. Jahrhunderts"-Atmosphäre stimmig. Erwähnt werden muss hierbei noch die enorme Brutalität, insbesondere bei Nahkampf-Finishern, die nicht jedem zwangsläufig gefallen dürfte. 

Was Bioshock Infinite besonders macht, ist jedoch seine Handlung. Auch wenn das Videospiel nur mit den bisher genannten Merkmalen daherkäme, so wäre es kein schlechtes Spiel. Da es sich hier jedoch nicht um ein stumpfes Abschlachten und Durchkämpfen handelt, ist Bioshock Infinite nicht nur ein solider Shooter sondern ein sehr gutes Spiel. Ohne hier spoilern zu wollen, lässt sich sagen, dass der Protagonist Booker DeWitt in die Wolkenstadt Columbia geschickt wird, um die junge Elizabeth zu seinem Auftraggeber in New York zu bringen. Bald wird jedoch klar, dass Elizabeth weit mehr ist als ein bloßer Auftrag ist und Booker selbst weit mehr Einfluss in ihrer Geschichte hat, als er zunächst ahnt.

Ich selbst habe für das einmalige Durchspielen von Bioshock Infinite auf dem normalen Schwierigkeitsgrad circa 10 Stunden benötigt, allerdings kann das Spiel bei Beendigung aller Nebenmissionen und Ansehen/Anhören von zusätzlichen Inhalten wahrscheinlich noch fünf Stunden mehr in Anspruch nehmen. Als einzigen Makel kann ich insgesamt nur die techische Umsetzung anführen. Enorme Framedrops und Ruckler treten bei vielen Spielern und selbst mit guter Hardware auf, da die nicht mehr ganz aktuelle Engine die Level hin und wieder nachlädt. Trotzdem ist das Spiel, insbesondere da diese Probleme nicht zwangsläufig auftreten, sehr gut spielbar und insbesondere im nächsten Steam-Angebot voll zu empfehlen.

Zuletzt möchte ich noch auf die DLC's verweisen, die es käuflich zu erwerben gibt. Inhaltlich kann ich zwar nichts zu jenen sagen, da sie nicht in meinem Besitz sind, jedoch stellen sie wirkliche Erweiterungen der Handlung da und sind nicht, wie heute leider bei vielen Spielen üblich, ein extra entferntes Element aus der Hauptstory.
Super jeu. Histoire prenante, décorts magiques. Super sypma!

За сестру изобью,

Oh...my....God!

This game is indefinitely different than Bioshock and Bioshock 2 where many elements which made this series memorable are missing. But there are few components in Bioshock Infinite that made the game interesting. All hope is not lost and all expectation is slightly satisfied.  

Before I write about the perks of this game, I would like to point out the elements that the developers have removed from this game. 

1) The weapons - Players are only allowed to hold two weapons at each time rather than acquiring all the weapons. In Bioshock 1, I used only the wrench the whole time except when fighting with big daddies and in Bioshock 2, I had the chance to upgrade most weapons and use most of them based on the enemies encountered. In Bioshock Inifinite, I used mostly the RPG and carbine with alternative to rifle. Players need to know the weapons advantages before acquiring them or have the chance to acquire weapons based on its availability. The ammos during the fighting scene can deplete fast so its lucky you have Elizabeth around to equip you with ammos. Players also need to use money and I mean lots of money to upgrade and buy ammos which is normal but can get very expensive at times. 

2) The enemies - Enemies are varied in Bioshock Infinite, you have citizen of Columbia, police, soldiers, security machines, firemen, handyman, motorized patriot and many more. They come in waves, starting with the normal enemies to the toughest enemies which is fine but I find it was done repetitively throughout the game. You enter a place, there are a waves of enemies and when you enter another place, another waves of enemies comes to attack you. In Bioshock 1 and 2, many types of splicers are found with Big Daddies and Big Sisters too. Nevertheless, if I compared Big Daddies and Handyman, I would prefer Big Daddies because I can plan out strategy to take them down but for Handyman, they come in the final waves where I don't have time to prepare them for a deathly attack. 

3) Moral choices - When players can choose to either save or sacrifice little sisters in Bioshock 1 and 2, they are robbed from these choices this time. Players can only choose once to either throw the ball at the couples or at the announcer. Other times, they just need to shoot people. 

4) Playtime - I could finish the game in 20 hours compared to Bioshock 1 and 2 which I spent 41 and 33 hours respectively. Of course, that was possible because of the save button which is explained below.

5) Save button - I hated this game for not featuring the save button and almost constantly I need to rely on auto save which is tough especially if I want to rest and if I want to redo some of the fighting scenes. I still don't understand why the developer removed this at the first place.

6) Cartoon, much? - Compared to Bioshock 1 and 2, the scenes in this game felt more like a cartoon especially the character's face. Sometimes, Columbia feels like a real world but when I turn my face to the characters, I realize they look like cartoons. I hope I adjusted the settings correctly though. 

7) Absence of hard work - When players had a chance to align the pipes in Bioshock 1 and click the arrow in the green/blue zones in Bioshock 2, players are unable to solve puzzles to unlock the safe, doors and security bot in Bioshock Infinite. This minor puzzles is what made the previous two games entertaining. Not to forget, the research camera that proves to be helpful in the previous Bioshock games are missing. Developers did include code book to help out cipher the puzzle but I don't find it enough. Without the puzzles, the gameplay is easy - just shoot and kill. 

8) Security bots - No, you could not have depersonalized them. I loved it when my security bots had names and ability to control them with the tonic but Bioshock Infinite, took them away. With the possession vigor, you can only possess them for a short while which is sad. However, players can open the tear to bring in motorized patriot, gun automaton and mosquito. They can only be used in fight scenes and have limited movements as in they can't follow you around. 

Despite the major things that are left out in Bioshock Infinite, there are perks that made me liked the game.

1) The storyline - From the beginning of the game, you play as Booker Dewitt who needs to go to Columbia to save a girl and pay his debt, but it didn't turn out well when the girl is very precious to Zachary Comstock. The tug of war between Booker Dewitt and Zachary Comstock with the Vox in between made the story interesting. My experience when I played during the first 30 minutes, I was confused not knowing what to do but followed the quests given to continue the story. Besides, I felt that the ending was a little bit rushed and again I was confused what was really happening. I liked the part where they relate the game to Bioshock 1 which was memorable. Nevertheless, the storyline made this game worth.

2) The environment - Players can explore an immense environment and have fun at the exhibition at the very beginning of the game. Oh and I love the rail which feels like I am riding a roller coaster. The scenes are beautiful as always except when it befalls to destruction. There is also less horror and darkness in Bioshock Infinite and I could clearly see everything. I also like the part where they prompt you to adjust the brightness before playing the game. 

3) Characters - I find it funny that the characters only speak individually or in group when I am near them and got the stare if I stayed too long. They are adults, old people, children, priests, nun, shop keepers, musicians, the elites and the poor. It is enjoyable to listen to their stories and gossips which I could never find in Bioshock 1 and 2. Normal human beings are non-exsistant in those. Besides, I liked the Lutece twins who brought humor to the game. 

4) Music - This game similar to Bioshock 1, has some pleasant musics which I never heard before. It is soothing to the ear and made this game more interesting. Parts that I like was in Shantytown, where one girl was singing "Shake Sugaree"and the other was playing a guitar, a lady singing "Fortunate Son" while sitting on the wall and Elizabeth singing "Will the Cirlce be Unbroken" while Booker Dewitt playes the guitar. 

5) Weapons - There are never heard before weapons such as volley gun, hail fire, hand cannon, crank gun, burstgun, heater and carbine. I rarely use them but I look forward to using them when I play Bioshock Inifnite again. 

6) Vigors, voxophones, kinetoscopes and telescopes - Similar to tonics and audio diaries, players can use vigors for additional powers and listen to stories through voxophones. Additonally, players can look through visual story through kinetoscopes and look at the beautiful Columbia via telescopes. 

7) Songbird - A yet intimidating character that I thought I will fight at the very end but never had the chance. I find it sad that it had to die eventually. :( 

8)  Elizabeth - The saviour of the game who can kicks ass by providing ammos or health or vigors and open tears during fight scenes and open the doors using lockpicks. She is your partner in crime who always be there for you except when she runs away three times and Dewiitt had to find her. 

Overall, I find Bioshock Infinite likeable due to the interesting storyline and lovable characters but it lacks the depth in terms of gameplay that the first Bioshock has brought. I have not tried playing Burial at Sea Episode 1 and 2 but I do hope it will live to its expectations.

Только - только прошел игру, и сразу решил написать обзор.
Чтож. Игра вызывает смешанные чувства. Проходя игру дальше и дальше, вы понимаете, что за красивой картинкой "Небесного города", за ярким солнцем и чистым небом, кроется самое гнилое и страшное нутро города.
По мере прохождения вы углубитесь в самые жуткие места города, увидите что под золотым убранством таится ужас.
Над людьми ставят опыты, создаются "Патриоты", роботы убийцы, в подземельях сжигают людей, те кто пошел против воли правительства - оказался в псих больнице в окружении кукол и хирургов.
Пропаганда мирной жизни не заставляет жителей усомнится в ней, пока не приходит наш главный герой.
О сюжете могу сказть лишь одно, вам придется исправить ошибку жизни главного героя, огромную ошибку.
Под конец игры приготовьтесь к резкому повороту событий и вы поймете на что человек способен в отчаянии.
Игра безусловно стоит своих денег.
В техническом плане игра великолепна и красива 10 золотых орлов из 10.

Bioshock Infinite è a mio parere il titolo migliore della serie.E' un gioco dove non sono solo i personaggi a fare  da protagonisti,ma anche l'ambiente che li circonda,i particolari.Lo si può godere anche se non si ha un PC estremamente potente il chè è un bene poichè la storia che narra questo gioco DEVE essere raccontata a più persone possibile.Una storia capace di farti venire i brividi dall'inizio alla fine che si gusta solo a metà se non si ascolta la storia di ogni personaggio,da Booker a Comstock , e non si rigioca una seconda volta...
E' il mio gioco preferito,come questo non esiste nessuno ,se trovate un buon affare compratelo senza pensarci due volte.

Maybe this is how all Bioshock games are, I'm not sure because I never finished the earlier titles in the series (that's another story which I [i]will[/i] go into here) but suffice it to say this game is a modern day classic that no gamer should go without playing.

Bioshock is an interesting game. If it had come out about a year earlier it migth have joined my pantheon of Greatest Ever Games Played, but as it stood the game came out just after I left home to commence university studies and suffered from what many other games of that period suffered from: My inability to hold an interest in narrative. I just couldn't play games through - as evidenced in the hundreds of hours I put into the segmented and compartmentalized Football Manager series - and the fact remained that I would not complete a narrative-driven game until years later when Deus Ex: Human Revolution was just so damn good that it busted through my study haze and established itself firmly at the top of my list of GOAT games.

This one comes close. I first played it on 360 but sold the console when I kept buying games for it without completeing a single one of them, then repurchased it via Steam four or five months ago. On that playthrough it very nearly became the next in an ever shortening list of games that I have completed - only sidetracked by my making a new save very close to the end of my playthrough without realizing that it would basically wipe the old save.

Bioshock Infinite cannot be overestimated. It is a masterpeice of a game, a painting of a game. It is heavily curated and directed, meticulously poured over with strategically placed instances of detail all over. It is at once an oldfashioned game from the time when there were no indy games but there were niche games with balances skewed a little to far towards detailed gameplay for general consumption - full of repeated themes and objects - but also an awesomely contemporary game with slick technology and fantastic animations. In short, you cannot really get any better than this game for achieving the sorts of sensations that they are trying to achieve. Occulus Rift might be an extremely good way to enjoy it.

Told exclusively in the first person in a manner directly derived from the Half Life series, as well as from earlier games of the same -Shock designation, the player navigates a colossal floating city ruled over by a dufus known as Comstock - though the real villain, omnipresent and forbidding, is simply the aura of racism and the ambient darkness of a society that has had it's dark, predjudiced soul unbound and given freedom to propogate in isolation. Frankly it kinda feels like a giant racist internet forum where people are actually capable of following through on their threats.

You can use seamlessly intergrated magic powers of a sort, the guns are all punchy (to paraphrase every positive gamespot review for an FPS ever), movement is heavily tailored but nontheless responsive and practically effective, and while the gameplay can sometimes get a tad tedious and repetetive, this is combatted by frequent changes in setting, a forgiving difficulty level and a vaguely truncated campain - which is to say, it is not a short campaign, but it is so fun that time flies quickly, and the destination it flies you [i]to[/i] is not so distant as to feel like you're running a gaming marathon.

Why should you get this game? Why do I say it is a modern classic? The story is just so big, the characters so good, the telling to stylish and immersive, the mechanics so slick, the setting so awe-inspiring and the enemies so odious that the whole thing just feels like it was [i]meant[/i] to be a game. It was meant to be. Play this game, you will be doing yourself a favour, though you may ruin every other narrative-driven FPS released in the last five or six years (with the exception of the peerless Deus Ex: HR) in the process.

Definitely one of the best games of all time! It has really great mechanics, good ai, almost no bugs (in fact in 18 hours I haven't seen one), an amazing art, it's immensely detailed and the most awesome story ever seen in a video game! It's impossible to express in words how much this game is amazing!

Beneath a campy exterior and somewhat silly premise (floating cities and some things that appear later I will not spoil for anyone), there is a genuine masterpiece of a character-oriented, dark yet beautiful story here. This game reached a depth of my soul few others have, and is incredibly underrated in this regard, being passed over frequently as another mindless FPS with pseudo-superpowers.

Above average shooter gameplay, solid plot, excellent voice acting, amazing soundtrack, and incredible overall execution that will leave you with strong emotions and many questions. I have no reason at all not to recommend this as highly as I can.

Bioshock Infinite on Bioshock ja Bioshock 2:n jälkeen tuleva peli. Peli julkaistiin viime vuonna. Omasta mielestäni vuoden 2013 paras peli. 
Gaming experience oli mahtava. Elikkäs peli kertoo Booker Dewitt -nimisestä miehestä. ”Bring us the girl and wipe away the debt”. Tämä lause pelistä lyhyesti kertoo pelin idean. 
Sinun tehtäväsi on matkata Columbian lentävään maahan. Tämä peli poikkeaa edeltäjistään siten, että tämä peli käydään maan päällä. Tarkalleen ottaen ilmassa. 
Mutta tietenkin matka vie myös vedenalaiseen kaupunkiin Raptrueen (Bioshock&Bioshock 2 maailmaan). 
Pelin läpäiseminen vie noin 8h, jos menet ”shoot and go”. Mutta normaalille pelaajalle menee noin 10-15h. Itse vedin pelin 14:ssa tunnissa. 
Niin pelin tehtävänä on tuoda Elisabeth Columbiasta joillekkin ihmisille. 
Peli on niin epäselvä etten itsekkään ymmärrä kaikkea. Mutta erittäin hyvä peli on –  suosittelen 5/5
Первый раз играл в 2013 году и как то не оценил. Вротой раз решил пройти сейчас, прошел все три части. Однозначно шедевр 11/10 !
